contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox New Zealand suburbs | name = Oranga | image = | caption1 = | city1 = Auckland City | city2 = | ward = | established = | area = | population = | popdate = | trainstations = | ferryterminals = | airports = | hospitals = | north = [[Greenlane]] | northeast = [[Ellerslie, New Zealand|Ellerslie]] | east = [[Penrose, New Zealand|Penrose]] | southeast = [[Te Papapa]] | south = [[Onehunga]] | southwest = [[Onehunga]] | west = [[Royal Oak]] | northwest = [[One Tree Hill, New Zealand|One Tree Hill]] | map = | caption2 = }} [[Image:OrangaCommCentre.JPG|thumbnail|300px|right|The Oranga Community Centre.]]<!-- this image is fixed to the infobox width - if the infobox width changes, please change the width of this image --> [[Image:State Housing in Oranga, Auckland, 1947.jpg|thumb|right|State houses in the 'Harp of Erin' estate in Oranga, seen in 1947. Note the typical suburban [[cul-de-sac]] layout.]]<!-- this image is fixed to the infobox width - if the infobox width changes, please change the width of this image --> '''Oranga''' is a small residential [[suburb]] in [[Auckland]], [[New Zealand]]. It is located nine kilometres to the southeast of the city centre, between the commercial suburbs of [[Te Papapa]] and [[Penrose, New Zealand|Penrose]] to the south and east, and the residential suburbs of [[One Tree Hill, New Zealand|One Tree Hill]] and [[Onehunga]] to the north and south, with which it is frequently confused. The name is from a Maori word, Oranga (noun) - meaning 'survivor, food, livelihood, welfare, health, living' <ref>[http://www.maoridictionary.co.nz]</ref> It used to be a [[state housing]] neighbourhood for low-income families, but it is rapidly gentrifying. Private investors have bought up many of the state houses for renovation, and to subdivide their generous [[Yard (land)|sections]]. [[Real estate]] agents increasingly advertise these houses as belonging to the wealthier suburb of One Tree Hill. Local facilities include Oranga Kindergarten (neighbouring Fergusson Domain), and Oranga Primary School.<ref>[http://www.oranga.school.nz Oranga Primary School]</ref> The local Secondary schools are [[One Tree Hill College]], [[Marcellin College, New Zealand|Marcellin College]] and [[St Peter's College, Auckland|St Peter's College]]. == References == {{Reflist}} {{coord|-36.911505|174.802473|region:NZ_type:city|display=title}} [[Category:Suburbs of Auckland]]
